condition.narration: Yuki, Takuya, and Isabella sit at the inner fencing of the airfield. Good old Haneda. Good old airfields. Isabella connects her condenser microphone to the USB port of her external battery-powered desktop computer and begins recording through the high speed data connector and sound-checks through the neodymium-magnet headphones.
condition.line: I can't believe they let us just enter an airport with all this strange equipment.
There are so few return trips now.
Security's so lax that Haneda would allow in a terrorist.
Every time I saw some different-tongued tourist or lost foreigner,
I thought, "Wow. We're still a world power. We're still on top."
"They still dig us more than we dig them. Maybe this 'Japan' thing will be okay."
You listening, Yuki? You don't get that good-old middle-age wisdom too often.

choice.line: You didn't use the word "Postwar" enough.
The critics only care when you talk Postwar.
I can't sit here and listen to this language all day.
Speak my tongue sometime, yours is tiring.
You am try to get on nerves of me!
